annotation.TEXT: Aha! There's what I'm looking for!
Gulp!
The buzzies down here appear to be tricky, but I can either wait until they move all the way to the left, or I can stand under a turn block column and just jump there. Not a problem!
I'll just sand cloud the green shell itself, carefully go back for that Yoshi Coin, then move on.
Double hit!
With enemy generators, like the parabombs here, I only need to hit one of them. Be careful not to let a bob-omb blow up another target on you!
P-switch BGM: Mega Man 4 - Final Wily Battle
GOOOOOAAAAALLLLL!!!!!
BGM: Kid Icarus NES - Underworld
Triple hit!
Double hit!
Gulp!
Ah, good. Now I can pretend that mistake in Vanilla Dome 1 never happened. (You saw nothing!)
Alright, let's try that again, shall we?
Alright, now back to the mission at hand.
This Piranha Plant is tricky. Maneuvering to the edge of its pipe while it's up in the air seems to work best.
I finally decided to take them on one at a time.
Now to finish with 1 bonus star...
BTW, if you try taking off from the pipe on the right, you won't get enough height. Take off from here instead.

So, I ended up resorting to using savestates between each level in this challenge. Sorry about that, but long challenges tend to wear me out, and also ZSNES is more likely to desynch my videos, and that's no fun!
Oh, yeah. Can't forget to hit the green shell itself!
Fly, of course!
That went pretty well, actually.
Hahaha! Okay, that works too!
Now, this is the only green shell available. All the rest are red. Be careful with it!
Hmm... Yoshi can't climb the vine. What do I do?
Double hit!
Sure, it's slower, but I have more time left than usual at this point, so I should be okay.
There is a green koopa in this room, but forget trying to use it to sand cloud buzzies. Maybe it's technically possible to get the last buzzy without dying, but I'm not going to bother.
D'oh! That wasn't supposed to happen!
Here's a trick: Spit out the shell at the exact moment you stomp the ground, and you'll hit it with the sand cloud! I'll be using that a lot.
In the first half of this level, it's okay if Yoshi swallows some koopas, as long as I already sand-clouded it!
Yeah, time's short. I have to be fast in most of the levels or time WILL run out! (However, that might not necessarily be the end of me...)
Be careful not to KO a spike top with the buzzy here. That was a close one!
First, I'll eat the blue shell here, because the red shell is too spicy.
SMW challenge from Ev55555: Hit every enemy in the Vanilla Dome using yellow Yoshi's sand cloud ability.
It takes good timing to get these guys. I could just remove their wings first, but I don't think I'll have enough time to do that on every koopa!

Now, I do think that this is a good challenge, with making me use yellow Yoshi's ability and all, but it's too easy to make a mistake, and trying to stay perfect for six tricky levels straight is too much.
If I have over 140 left on the clock at midpoint, I'm doing well. If it's under 100, it might be best to restart.
Okay, from this point forward, I don't want Yoshi to swallow anymore, since that's all of the green koopas.
Also, I should try to swallow the last enemy so that I write "Gulp!" whenever possible!
If done correctly, just hang out on the left side of the spiny pit, and the rest will become easy!
In addition, I must collect 5 Yoshi Coins in each level that has them, and get 1 bonus star from every goal.
Important: Spit out the shell on the left side of this pit. If you do it on the right side, the spinies up ahead become harder to hit!
Gulp!
One nice thing: A sand-clouded koopa on the ground here won't go high enough to hit the others!
Ooh, that was cool!
Whoa! Yes, I missed, but if I didn't spit out the shell right there, Yoshi might've swallowed it!
I kill the ones I've successfully hit with a sand cloud to make things easier.
Up next: Vanilla Secret 1. (Yes, that fast-forward was necessary!)
Star BGM: Kirby series - Invincible Lollipop (requested by Ev55555)
Got 'em! Now I just have to get the last Yoshi Coin (which is in the previous pipe), and finish!
Try not to let Yoshi swallow any shells! They're not always in ample supply!
Now, these four koopas are a pain. I failed on these guys so many times.
Double hit!
BGM: Donkey Kong Land - Temple
If I didn't speed up a portion of one of the first three levels, I wouldn't have been able to fit this video within 11 minutes, so I decided to speed up this room.
In this room, I have to avoid killing anything on my way to a usable shell near the end. Shouldn't be too hard...
WARNING! RANT ALERT!
I have to be extra careful, though. It's very easy to accidentally bounce one koopa into another with a sand cloud!
However, if the levels are short or the mission is fast, then maybe three or four levels is okay, but try not to go overboard please. I hope that this is okay with all of you.
And now, for the koopa-flooded Vanilla Secret 2!
The timer is less of a threat in this level, so it's okay to be more cautious.
I'm often going to scroll the screen in such a way to avoid having multiple koopas near each other.
Oops! Missed there. I'll get him in a moment.
Just great. Now I'm without a feather until the next level. I can still manage, though.
Oh, boy. This part's tricky. I have to carefully knock down these guys then sand cloud them.
Next, I want to get the Chuck up ahead before he splits.
So here's what I'm thinking: When giving me challenges in the future, try to limit them to one or two levels.
BGM: Sonic & Knuckles - Lava Reef Zone Act 1
Gulp!
To be continued...
Now I can...
This is a tricky Yoshi Coin. It would be easier if I was small, but I don't feel like taking an intentional hit right now!
BGM: Ninja Gaiden NES - Act 4-2 - "Ryu's Determination"
Done! I've hit every possible target in the level, so I just have to get all the Yoshi Coins, and finish with 1 bonus star.
Good! I hit all the targets in this room, so I can just do whatever until I enter the next room.
Gulp!
How dare you dodge me! Take this!
I like to destroy each target after sand-clouding it, as a way of keeping track of what I've already hit. It's not absolutely necessary, though.
Yes, this speed up is necessary, too.
Done!
